W.M. 54(45). 27th April, 1945. 6.30 p.m. T.U.C. Representation at San Francisco. b)
P.M. Looks as tho’ L.P. is not disposed to give way. If this is conceded, a) where do we stop – e.g. reparations, dismemberment etc. how can they advise unless given full informn. M/L. These Confces are for Govts., who must be responsible. H.O. Endorsed this view – esp. in view of threat in penultimate para. M/L. Mustn’t give way to Citrine. P.M. Say War Cab. has held special mtg. & adhere to earlier decision. 28/3. Willing to listen to his repns & consider suggns. Agreed.
